See an overview of the installed database tables.
Click the '%1' button to create the tables in the database.
Click the '%1' button to check your licenses.
Click the '%1' button to upgrade the tables in the database.
The data stored in the database tables has been successfully migrated.

1. Check the options that define your database connection:
• configserver.php file: DBSERVER and DBTYPE
• config.php file: DBSELECT, DBUSER and DBPASS
2. Check if your database is up and running and accessible through the configured connection '%1'.
3. Make sure that user '%2' has access to the database.
4. In case of a new installation, make sure that an empty database (table space) named '%3' is manually pre-created.
5. Once you have repaired the configuration, click '%4'.
The database tables have been successfully created.
The database tables have been successfully upgraded.

For deadlines, specify an absolute date or a relative time. This must be before the actual publication date. Click the Recalculate button to update the absolute date or relative time. Note that recalculation respects working hours.

You have created a new Sticky Note or have replied to a Sticky Note without entering text. If you continue, the Sticky Note or reply will be deleted.

Issue ID may not be empty.
This feature should only be used when an issue cannot be removed by using the Unpublish option in the Digital Publishing application in Content Station.
When deleting an issue which is still set as Published in Content Station, synchronization issues may occur between Enterprise Server and Adobe DPS.
Use this feature at your own risk.
WARNING: This page allows you to remove a published issue from Adobe DPS.

WARNING: You are about to remove a published issue from Adobe DPS.

This should only be done when an issue cannot be removed by using the Unpublish option in the Digital Publishing application in Content Station.
Deleting an issue which is still set as Published in Content Station can cause synchronization issues between Enterprise Server and Adobe DPS.

After you have been notified by the support desk (e.g. via e-mail), you can click the Retry button to reclaim your license.
Together with the serial number and contact info you provide, the system code of the current Enterprise server will be transmitted to the WoodWing registration server.

If the date or time on the %1 is wrong, then first change the date or time on that server. To handle time zones properly, specify date.timezone in the [PHP] section of PHP.ini. Or one may use the TZ environment setting. After changing the setting(s), don't forget to restart the Web service and/or database service.

All license privileges of the previous configuration should stay available on the previous configuration. In fact, a new license should be activated for the new configuration, without deactivating licenses from the other configuration.

The WoodWing license is attached to a specific system configuration. If you change your system configuration, the license will only be valid for a limited time and expire after a while. You should reclaim your license to attach it to the new system configuration to continue working with Enterprise.

Use this form in case you wish to send license information from your Enterprise configuration to the WoodWing support department.
To activate the use of a WoodWing product, your serial number needs to be validated.

Note that it is better to deactivate licenses first, if possible. If the license is not deactivated first, the WoodWing activation server will not be notified and activating the license later may result in a limited number of concurrent connections or users.

There are workflow files stored in your database, which has become an obsoleted feature since v8.0. There is no support to migrate those files to the File Store. Therefore, you need to start with a clean database. Alternatively, when you are very sure that the File Store is used and that all records in the database table named 'smart_storage' contain files that can be safely removed, you could clean that table and proceed with the migration.
